Name: Platypus variant
Description: A Haplotype-Based Variant Caller For Next Generation Sequence Data

Name: PLINK
Description: whole genome association analysis toolset

Name: PointFinder
Description: detects chromosomal mutations predictive of drug resistance based on WGS data

Name: PoPoolation2
Description: Compare allele frequencies for SNPs between two or more populations and to identify significant differences

Name: Porechop
Description: Porechop is a tool for finding and removing adapters from Oxford Nanopore reads.

Name: preseq
Description: This package is aimed at predicting and number of distinct reads and how many will be expected from additional sequencing using an initial sequencing experiment. The estimates can then be used to examine the utility of further sequencing, optimize the sequencing depth, or to screen multiple libraries to avoid low complexity samples.

Name: Prinseq
Description: filter, reformat and trim NGS data

Name: ProbCons
Description: Probabilistic Consistency-based Multiple Alignment of Amino Acid Sequences

Name: Prodigal
Description: Fast, reliable protein-coding gene prediction for prokaryotic genomes.

Name: Prokka
Description: Annotation of prokaryotic genomes

Name: pronto
Description: Pronto is a Python library to parse, browse, create, and export ontologies, supporting several ontology languages and formats

Name: PSASS
Description: Software to compare pooled sequencing datasets from two groups (usually two sexes).

Name: pycoQC
Description: pycoQC computes metrics and generates Interactive QC plots from the sequencing summary report generated by Oxford Nanopore technologies basecaller (Albacore/Guppy)

Name: pyScaf
Description: Orders contigs from genome assemblies

Name: qcat
Description: qcat is a Python command-line tool for demultiplexing Oxford Nanopore reads from FASTQ files.

Name: QIIME
Description: Pipeline for performing microbiome analysis from raw DNA sequencing data

Name: qualimap
Description: Platform-independent application written in Java and R that provides both a Graphical User Inteface (GUI) and a command-line interface to facilitate the quality control of alignment sequencing data.

Name: QuasiRecomb
Description: Probabilistic inference of viral quasispecies subject to recombination (viral haplotype reconstruction)

Name: QUAST
Description: Evaluates genome assemblies

Name: r-metabarcoding-toolbox
Description: Homemade toolbox with common tools used in R for metabacording analysis

Name: r
Description: R base

Name: ra
Description: Overlap-layout-consensus based DNA assembler of long uncorrected reads (short for Rapid Assembler).

Name: Racon
Description: Ultrafast consensus module for raw de novo genome assembly of long uncorrected reads

Name: ragout
Description: Tool for assisted assembly using multiple references. It takes a short read assembly (a set of contigs), a set of related references and a corresponding phylogenetic tree and then assembles the contigs into scaffolds.

Name: RagTag
Description: Reference-guided genome assembly correction and scaffolding

Name: Raven
Description: De novo genome assembler for long uncorrected reads

Name: RAxML
Description: Randomized Axelerated Maximum Likelihood.

Name: Rcorrector
Description: kmer-based error correction method for RNA-seq data

Name: rdp_classifier
Description: Naive Bayesian classifier that can rapidly and accurately provide taxonomic assignments from domain to genus

Name: rdp_classifier
Description: Naive Bayesian classifier that can rapidly and accurately provide taxonomic assignments from domain to genus

Name: remoVecSec
Description: Module and script to remove contamination in assembled genomes before submission to ncbi

Name: RpARK
Description: wrapper script for constructing a repeat library from sequencing reads

Name: REPdenovo
Description: constructing repeats directly from sequence reads

Name: RepeatModeler
Description: De-Novo Repeat Discovery Tool

Name: RGI
Description: Resistance Gene Identifier (RGI) predicts resistome(s) from protein or nucleotide data based on homology and SNP models

Name: roary
Description: A high speed stand alone pan genome pipeline, which takes annotated assemblies in GFF3 format (produced by Prokka (Seemann, 2014)) and calculates the pan genome.

Name: RStudio
Description: Tool for statistics

Name: salmon
Description: quantifying the expression of transcripts using RNA-seq data

Name: SALSA2
Description: A tool to scaffold long read assemblies with Hi-C data

Name: SAMBA-ROME
Description: Workflow for the standardized and automated analyses of the metabarcoding data from the ROME project.

Name: SAMBA
Description: Standardized and Automated MetaBarcoding Analyses.

Name: sambamba
Description: parallel robust and fast tool for working with SAM and BAM files

Name: samblaster
Description: A tool to mark duplicates and extract discordant and split reads from SAM files.

Name: SAMtools
Description: Provides various utilities for manipulating alignments in the SAM format

Name: sartools
Description: A tool for statistical analysis of RNA-Seq

Name: Scrappie
Description: Technology demonstrator for the Oxford Nanopore Research Algorithms group

Name: seqc
Description: Single-Cell Sequencing Quality Control and Processing Software

Name: seqkit
Description: Tool to manipulate fastq files

Name: SeqTk
Description: A fast and lightweight tool for processing sequences in the FASTA or FASTQ format

Name: SGA
Description: De novo sequence assembler using string graphs

Name: SHAPEIT4
Description: fast and accurate method for estimation of haplotypes (aka phasing) for SNP array and high coverage sequencing data

Name: shasta
Description: De novo assembly from Oxford Nanopore reads.

Name: ShoRAH
Description: Short Reads Assembly into Haplotypes

Name: shovill
Description: Microbial assembly pipeline for Illumina paired-end reads

Name: signalP
Description: predicts the presence and location of signal peptide cleavage sites in amino acid sequences

Name: Simka
Description: De novo comparative metagenomics tool

Name: slow5tools
Description: Slow5tools is a simple toolkit for converting (FAST5 <-> SLOW5), compressing, viewing, indexing and manipulating data in SLOW5 format, a new file format for storing signal data from Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) devices.

Name: SMRT Tools
Description: Suite available for analysis of DNA sequencing data from Pacific Biosciences’ SMRT technology

Name: Smudgeplot
Description: Inference of ploidy and heterozygosity structure using whole genome sequencing data

Name: snakemake
Description: Workflow engine and language. It aims to reduce the complexity of creating workflows by providing a fast and comfortable execution environment, together with a clean and modern domain specific specification language (DSL) in python style.

Name: Sniffles
Description: structural variation caller using third generation sequencing (PacBio or Oxford Nanopore)

Name: Snippy
Description: Rapid haploid variant calling and core SNP phylogeny

Name: snpeff
Description: Variant annotation and effect prediction tool. It annotates and predicts the effects of variants on genes and proteins (such as amino acid changes).

Name: snpsift
Description: Toolbox that allows you to filter and manipulate annotated vcf files.

Name: SNVoter
Description: Improving SNV detection from low coverage nanopore sequencing data (<30x)

Name: SOAPdenovo
Description: short-read assembly method that can build a de novo draft assembly for the human-sized genomes

Name: SortMeRNA
Description: next-generation sequence filtering and alignment tool

Name: SourceTracker
Description: Bayesian approach to estimating the proportion of a novel community that comes from a set of source environments

Name: sourmash
Description: Compute MinHash signatures for nucleotide (DNA/RNA) and protein sequences

Name: Spades
Description: An assembly toolkit containing various assembly pipelines

Name: SRA Toolkit
Description: The SRA Toolkit and SDK from NCBI is a collection of tools and libraries for using data in the INSDC Sequence Read Archives

Name: SSpace-long read
Description: A program for scaffolding pre-assembled contigs using long reads

Name: SSpace-Standard
Description: stand-alone program for scaffolding pre-assembled contigs using NGS paired-read data

Name: stacks
Description: An analysis tool set for population genomics

Name: star
Description: A ultrafast universal RNA-seq aligner

Name: Strainberry
Description: Strain separation in low-complexity metagenomes using error-prone long-read technologies

Name: StringTie
Description: Fast and highly efficient assembler of RNA-Seq alignments into potential transcripts

Name: Structure
Description: a free software package for using multi-locus genotype data to investigate population structure

Name: SVIM
Description: Structural variant identification using long reads

Name: swarm
Description: A robust and fast clustering method for amplicon-based studies.

Name: T-Coffee
Description: A collection of tools for Computing, Evaluating and Manipulating Multiple Alignments

Name: tabix
Description: Generic indexer for TAB-delimited genome position files

Name: TaxMapper
Description: Analysis tool for a reliable mapping to a provided microeukaryotic reference database

Name: taxonkit
Description: A Practical and Efficient NCBI Taxonomy Toolkit

Name: TEclass
Description: TEclass classifies unknown transpsosable element (TE) consensus sequences into four categories, according to their mechanism of transposition: DNA transposons, LTRs, LINEs, SINEs

Name: TMHMM
Description: prediction of transmembrane helices in proteins

Name: Tombo
Description: Tombo is a suite of tools primarily for the identification of modified nucleotides from nanopore sequencing data.

Name: tooldirectory
Description: Dynamic visualization of softwares managed by a Bioinformatics Core Facility

Name: Tophat2
Description: A fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads

Name: Trans-ABySS
Description: De novo assembly of RNAseq data using ABySS

Name: TransDecoder
Description: identifies candidate coding regions within transcript sequences

Name: transrate
Description: de-novo transcriptome assembly quality analysis

Name: TreeMix
Description: Method for inferring the patterns of population splits and mixtures in the history of a set of populations

Name: Trimgalore
Description: A tool to automate quality and adapter trimming as well as quality control

Name: Trimal
Description: A tool for automated alignment trimming in large-scale phylogenetic analyses

Name: Trimmomatic
Description: A flexible trimmer for Illumina sequence data

Name: Trinity
Description: De novo assembly of RNA-Seq data

Name: Trinotate
Description: Annotate transcripts generated by Trinity

Name: trnascan-se
Description: A program for improved detection of transfer RNA genes in genomic sequence.

Name: Trycycler
Description: Tool for generating consensus long-read assemblies for bacterial genomes.

Name: TSEBRA
Description: TSEBRA is a combiner tool that selects transcripts from gene predictions based on the support by extrisic evidence in form of introns and start/stop codons. It was developed to combine BRAKER1 and BRAKER2 predicitons to increase their accuracies.

Name: ucsc-bigbedtobed
Description: Convert from bigBed to ascii bed format.

Name: faToTwoBit
Description: Convert DNA from fasta to 2bit format

Name: UGENE
Description: free open-source cross-platform bioinformatics software

Name: Unicycler
Description: Assembly pipeline for bacterial genomes

Name: vadr
Description: Viral Annotation DefineR: classification and annotation of viral sequences based on RefSeq annotation

Name: vamb
Description: Improved metagenome binning and assembly using deep variational autoencoders.

Name: Variabel
Description: Novel approach and method for intrahost variant detection, which outperforms existing ONT variant callers

Name: VarScan
Description: variant detection in massively parallel sequencing data

Name: vcflib
Description: provides methods to manipulate and interpret sequence variation as it can be described by VCF

Name: VCFTools
Description: Program package designed for working with VCF files

Name: Velvet
Description: Sequence assembler for very short reads

Name: VIGA
Description: De novo Viral Genome Annotator. VIGA is a script written in Python 2.7 that annotates viral genomes automatically (using a de novo algorithm) and predict the function of their proteins using BLAST and HMMER

Name: vsearch
Description: vectorized search, the open-source alternative to usearch

Name: vt
Description: tool set for short variant discovery in genetic sequence data

Name: vulcan
Description: A long read mapping pipeline that melds minimap2 and NGMLR

Name: w2rap-contigger
Description: An Illumina PE genome contig assembler, can handle large (17Gbp) complex (hexaploid) genomes

Name: wengan
Description: An accurate and ultra-fast hybrid genome assembler

Name: WhatsHap
Description: WhatsHap is a software for phasing genomic variants using DNA sequencing reads, also called read-based phasing or haplotype assembly

Name: WHdenovo
Description: A cost-effective approach to diploid assembly for single samples and trios

Name: Winnowmap
Description: Winnowmap is a long-read mapping algorithm optimized for mapping ONT and PacBio reads to repetitive reference sequences.

Name: wtdbg2/Readbean
Description: A fuzzy Bruijn graph approach to long noisy reads assembly

Name: yacrd
Description: Yet Another Chimeric Read Detector

Name: yak
Description: Yet another k-mer analyzer
